boardgame.description:
User Summary

A tear-off pad of Clue Cards 14cm x 11cm allowing a Mastermind to write out individual clues with their three leads on.

boardgame.name: Yatzoo
boardgame.description: A Yahtzee variant for children from ages 5 up. Numbers in the dice have been replaced with animals, and you try to roll as many same animals as possible. There are no straights and no bonuses for the upper part of the scoring sheet, so the rules have been simplified quite a bit.

boardgame.name: EQULIBRIX Combact
boardgame.description: This package of black-and-white puzzle pieces brings completely new dimension into EQULIBRIX series. Every puzzle piece is unique in terms of its shape and ability to create the connections with other puzzle pieces. This time you will experience a very close duel on the Connect game board (the box does not contain the game board). How the duel will look like? It depends largely on the game option you choose.

boardgame.name: モックワード (Mock Word)
boardgame.description:
モックワード (Mock Word) is word game from Japan with a reversal on the common method. Instead of players trying to identify the hidden word, they have to fit words to hidden categories. The game can be played just for fun, or can be played more seriously to win or lose.

In Mock Word, one player is a Respondent, the other players form the Support, a co-operative team, of which one player is an Ojama. At the start of the game, the team players compose a series of words by secretly writing a single character at a time of cards. The cards get passed around, so each player contributes to forming the words. The Ojama is acting a sort of spoiler, secretly trying to make nonsense words as they form. This can produce hilarious words and makes the game a lot of fun.

Once the words are set, the Respondent tries to identify the theme words that fit each of the composed words. If they can, all the players score points except the Ojama. If the Respondent cannot match the words to the themes, then the Ojama scores points. At the game end, most points wins.
user summary

boardgame.name: Keyword
boardgame.description:
Keyword is a game where a player has to communicate a word to the rest of their team, describing it in terms of a secret "keyword" which only that team knows. A second team eavesdrops on the conversation, trying to work out what they're talking about.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Our Cartoon President
boardgame.description:
Let’s face it — nothing simulates the chaos of the current administration like a combination of rotten vegetables and confetti being dropped on a high-speed fan, but this game is the next best thing!

In this fast-moving card game, each player takes control of a group of government staffers and wins loyalty for their people while stealing it from others, all while trying to avoid the wrath of the president. People will be fired, transferred, and otherwise totally embarrassed, but there can be only one winner! And it sure won't be the nation!


Based on Stephen Colbert’s animated show Our Cartoon President.
Provides much needed laugh-out-loud outlet in regards to American Politics!
Blank Character cards allow you to keep up with political events!


—description from the back of the box

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The GearSeed Saga
boardgame.description:
The world of GearSeed is a peculiar place. Its seasons shift sporadically and the strange folk that call this world home do their best to adapt to its ever changing landscape.

The GearSeed Saga is a boxed collection of 2 completely different card games set in the same world.

SYNOD is a Kickstarter Exclusive Micro game for 2 players and was illustrated by Sandro Rybak.

GearSeed is a combo driven, tile laying card game for 2 to 4 players and features the illustrations of Oliver Howe. Artist Jason Benningfield is responsible for all of the icon work that ties these two games together.

listing.notes: Cards looked at, rules gently read, never played. Includes both GearSeed and SYNOD.

boardgame.name: EQUILIBRIX Project
boardgame.description: Project is actually an extension of the game Connect, because it uses most of the material from it and develops the main game principles in depth. This time, however, it is a political game in which you try to build various geometric shapes together. But you also get points for encircling your opponent.

boardgame.name: Rocky Mountain Man
boardgame.description:
American West, Folio 1

Players represent a leader and crew of Mountain Men around 1825, with various skills and equipment. The crews venture into the Rocky Mountains, exploring new hexes and drawing their discoveries in crayon. A player needs to manage their crew in trapping, hunting, dangers, movement, exploration, encounters, and more. While the beaver pelt is prized, further money can be made in exploration, discoveries, and finding routes to the Great Salt Lake and mapping the Colorado River.

Rocky Mountain Man is played either solitaire or against another player. If 2 players, both will play in a kind of simultaneous solitaire fashion.

The game is played in turns, a turn comprising several phases. After a turn is conducted another begins, continuing until either the time limit is complete, the goal is achieved, or the Trading Post is built (if playing a campaign), or if all crews have been killed.

In a two-player game, each player goes as fast or as patiently as they prefer. Each player may be in a completely different part of a phase than another. One player may complete several more turns than another, depending on their speed.

The game can be played in timed sessions, by achievement of goals, or as a campaign.

Victory is based on the kind of play. In s two-player game Victory Points determine the win. In solitaire, achieving a goal will provide victory.

Rocky Mountain Man is based on the Source of the Nile (1978) game system. While there are many of the same game rules, some have been adjusted and others added. For players familiar with Source of the Nile, it is good to know the general pattern of that game, but do not assume a rule will be exactly the same.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
I played the twice. Everything is in excellent condition.
It is a “folio game” meaning it did not come in a box. Cards have been neatly cut out. Crayons and map are in perfect condition as I put a sheet of plexiglass over the map and used wet-erase markers to play.
+$5 priority shipping Games posted next business day if payment eclipsed by 5 pm EST.

boardgame.name: Legends Untold: Illumination of Deepsorrow Novice Set
boardgame.description:
The Illumination of Deepsorrow is a standalone expansion for the Legends Untold system which can be enhanced with the addition of the Weeping Caves and Great Sewers Novice Sets. It can also be combined with these products to create a massive catalogue of cards for self-build adventures.
Deepsorrow introduces:
Four new playable Occupations and Cultures, along with a host of new Weapons, Kits, Outfits and Talents to let you build the character you want.

A new Focus system that allows you to use the mystic teachings of the Nabti Walkers to push your body and mind to the limits of endurance.

New Physiological Talents for the Wrathlander - use natural gifts to survive poison and even channel lightning!

A new Shock Condition that impacts both Heroes and Foes, beware that sparking floor tile!

A new Clues and Epilogues system that rewards exploration – will you brave that Vine Swing Barrier to reveal more about the multiple factions that have an interest in the ancient site?

New Boons and Backpack cards that let you expand your party’s arsenal of options, you must use them wisely to ensure your survival.

New Loot categories including Locked, Sealed, and Heavy, that require you to use all your wits to benefit from them.

A new Treasure deck system for those that always have to find every piece of loot.

A Cinematic Campaign of multiple Plot Arcs, that you must discover and interact as you explore Deepsorrow.

Exhausted, a messenger collapses on the steps of the temple. From his hand a single leaf drops to the floor and a shockwave echoes across the sanctuary. The Monks at Firesorrow have waited millennia for the sign - the Lost Forest has come to life - A Step into Darkness has begun.

Where the sky screams and black clouds roar
Where the sand climbs high and eagles soar
Secrets will travel by sail and oar
To Dip’Sa’Ra on distant shore

The violent wind whips sand across your face; overhead the constant lightning of the Wrathstorm earths into the enormous coral-like spires that tower above you. You are sworn to your quest: you must investigate the mysteries of Deepsorrow and find the ancient Illumolith so that you may shine a beacon of light and illuminate the approaching darkness.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legends Untold: Potions & Preparations Expansion Set
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Legends Untold: The Great Sewers Novice Set
Legends Untold: Weeping Caves Novice Set
Legends Untold: Weeping Caves Novice Set – Kickstarter Edition
Legends Untold: The Great Sewers Novice Set
Legends Untold: Weeping Caves Novice Set
Legends Untold: Weeping Caves Novice Set – Kickstarter Edition

boardgame.name: Raja Ampat: The Four Kings Islands
boardgame.description:
A little semi-abstract style game, where you are initially building the map of islands, then placing your wildlife tokens according to the following conditions: you cannot place an animal in a row, column or island that already contains that type of animal.


Released in the June 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: The Beloved Underbelly
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Lovingly illustrated in both digital and physical collage, this zine details the tunnels and sewers beneath a dystopian fantasy city, full of beekeepers and taxidermists and pigs and sorcerers.

The Beloved Underbelly is a faction-heavy, low-level adventure, for use with OSR-style games, such as 0e/BX/1e editions of a certain fantasy roleplaying game and their retroclones.

boardgame.name: Mountaineering: The Race to the Summit
boardgame.description:
The game is unbranded

The image on the box with coloured scene of climbers and a tent flying the British flag suggests that it was probably published in England after Sir Edmund Percival Hillary and Sherpa mountaineer Tenzing Norgay became the first climbers confirmed to have reached the summit of Mount Everest, on 29 May 1953.

Contents:

collapsible pyramid with mountain scenes printed in colours;
printed base with slots for the mountain;
four coloured, round headed playing pins;
one wooden dice;
one dice shaker;


The rules of the game are printed on the underside of the box lid.

boardgame.name: Dry Drowning
boardgame.description:
Dry Drowning is a dark visual novel set in a twisted dystopian world. We're working hard to reach our audience through deep, intense and meaningful interactive experiences, always pushing the boundaries of narrative and mechanics in games.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ArchiWrecks
boardgame.description:
ArchiWrecks is a card and dice game for 2 players: the architect that builds the city, and a giant monster that is attempting to smash the city.

ArchiWrecks is an asymmetric 2-player only dexterity game. One of the players takes on the role of architect constructing buildings out of dice, the other player takes on the role of a giant monster that is attempting to smash the city.

Each card has the Architect constructing a specific building with dice, the card also offers a way for the Monster player to attempt to wreck the building. After each round, the card is flipped and either shows the city making progress or the rubble of the city as the Monster smashed past.

boardgame.name: Pocket Pairs
boardgame.description:
Pocket Pairs is a fast-paced game about finding the commonalities among a card collection. A 9-card game where you must cut the cards into 18 1/2-size cards.


Pocket Pairs is a fast-paced card game about collecting cards, then deciding what items they have in common, such as a Pencil and Paper Clip are both found in an office. Add in a Toy Soldier and they all have a pointy bit! Great for teaching associations and developing critical thinking skills.


Released in the November 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #9)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue #9 of The Glatisant! This newsletter is a free service put out by the Questing Beast YouTube channel.

Reviews
Free Kriegsspiel Roleplaying
Artists
Theory
Adventure Design
Worldbuilding
Tables and Game Content
Miscellaneous Posts

boardgame.name: I Am… Alias
Sinä olet... Alias
boardgame.description:
Party game, where the players put on a headband and pick a card from a deck. Everyone attaches their card on the the headband and one person at a time tries to explain the word to another player (who cannot see their card). Right guess grants points and the player gets to move their pawn forward.

—user summary

Slap on a headband and get ready to explain! Tell the other players who they are, but don’t say the word on the card!
This time you can never be sure who you are, but you’re guaranteed to have a great time, aka lots of fun!

The player, who gets the furthest during a set number of rounds, wins the game!
Everyone plays at the same time!
The game is full of hilarious characters and funny moments.
A fast-moving, rib-tickling word explaining game!
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Miss Match
boardgame.description:
Miss Match is a fun, quick and simple game for 2-12 players of all ages.

Players race to find a link between the cards on the table in fun and creative ways. The cards are always changing so, think fast and shout out a match before someone else can. You keep the cards you matched and that’s how you score points in the game. The more cards you can match at once the more points you score each round.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cycle of the Snake-Wolf
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I know fear, for my village is forfeit. The witch coerces the flames into a whirlwind, and the hiss and crackle of wood is heard, sour, tinged by a snarl. It warps and ripples, a tear forming, and out pour the jaws of a wolf and the scales of a snake.” - A Guardian

Inspired by tales told in front of bonfires, comes a Terror of the Stratosfiend supplement focused on bones and what we do with them.

Inside of the Dungeon Crawl Classic compatible module you will find:

New Items: Trinkets that serve as strange luck charms
Bone Craft: How bones are adapted to armor and weaponry. What magic ESSENCE lies inside of the bones?
New Bestiary Entries: “Gargantuan Dryads” that trade limb for limb and the Terrifying (and teleporting) “Snake-Wolves” that come from beyond the stars (look at the cover art).
New Ritual Spell: “Snake-Wolf Cycling” that allows you to summon the a host of snake-wolves and harness their strange power.
New Spell Weapon: a bone truncheon forged from the ashes of a successful ritual.
Were-Snake-Wolves: a terrifying transformation
Scorched Bone Tea: it communicates with ghosts… perhaps they possess you?
New Deity: Council of the Snake-Wolf. A deep space commune-nest giving their own Canticles, divine favors as per the DCC Annual. They also come with new spellburn, patron taint, and lay on hands results.
New Curse: “Curse of the Cosmic Wasting” used for those that run from duty. It erodes your attributes over days.
New Carousing Table: what strange things do you find in the woods? Pterodactyl Eggs? A smoldering fire? Weapons-Satellites?
And a Rumor Table, everyone needs one.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Symbiosis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An accident causes the crew of the Galileo to awaken from cryosleep to a hull breach. Repairing it seems simple enough, but an alien organism that can assimilate human bodies tends to complicate matters... Symbiosis, a sci-fi one shot from Atomic Ninja Studios. Be afraid...

boardgame.name: The Invoker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pies Iesu Domine... (thunk)

Ever wanted to be a divine caster, with a bit less casting? ...no? Well too bad, because that's what you're getting with the Invoker, the new Base Class by Tipsy Tabby Publishing!

The invoker is one who channels divine energy into mantras, speaking holy words to boost, protect, and heal his allies! For the invoker, prayers have tangible effects on the world around him!

Because an invoker can only channel so much divine energy in a given time, he also learns to defend himself and his friends in battle, to better give them the bulwark of his divine path!

Built on the foundations of the Winning Warrior series, this is one priest who can really preach the faith!

boardgame.name: Mundane Chest Contents (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane chest contents to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Mundane Chest Contents (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane chest contents to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Mundane Chest Contents (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane chest contents to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Mundane Chest Contents (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane chest contents to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Facets of Fire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the year of our Lord 1321, the setting is the town, castle and priory of Dudley, within the northern reaches of Worcestershire.

The Monks of Dudley Priory are in disaray, the Abbot of Wenlock Abbey, their mother Monastery, has disapeared on route to the Priory bringing with him a Holy Relic.

Seeking help they have hired the Characters to help them. They have discovered that the Abbot has been taken by the local Baron Sir John de Somery, a tyrant who regards himself as King of all his dominion regardless of the wishes of the King of England.

The monks require the characters to rescue the Abbot and recover the Holy Relic before it gets used for evil acts.

boardgame.name: New Atami - Hot Chop Diner
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You want something tasty, chop chop?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a futuristic cyberpunk city diner, with a brightly neon lit street, and a well furnished diner.

boardgame.name: Camp of the Roverfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pull up a chair and enjoy the fire!

Camp of the Roverfolk is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Camp of the Roverfolk is a day & night set, comprising of 2 30x30 battlemaps. The map features a small camp of caravans near a river crossing. At night the fires blaze, casting shadows at the edge of the firelight.

The pack includes an A4 pdf document with 300dpi versions of each map. Also included is a set of gridded and gridless 300dpi full size jpgs for poster printing and 72dpi VTT-ready files.

boardgame.name: The White Crow Inn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Built on the sloping ground alongside a wide canal, The White Crow Inn is a large, well furnished tavern - with plenty of secrets!

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of a multi storey urban tavern, spread across eight 30x30 battlemaps, each depicting a different floor of the inn.

Sub-Basement - kitchen, cellars, sewers, canal bed.
Basement - Eating area, cellars, basements, lower street, terrace, canal-side
Ground floor - main taproom, market square, bridge
1st Floor - Minstrel stage, terrace
2nd Floor - cheap bedrooms
3rd Floor - expensive bedrooms & suites, small library for guests
Attic - Square cobwebbed area
Roof - Pitched roof with tall chimneys

boardgame.name: Uhluk's Fortress
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Surrounded by their fiercest warriors, Uhluk the Bugbear plans where to attack next
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting the stronghold of an orc, bugbear, hobgoblin or gnoll leader.

boardgame.name: Fortress of the Demonknight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sitting on a throne of skulls, the Demonknight rules his domain from this fearsome fortress.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a hellish landscape, filled with lava lakes and rivers, intense heat, demonic bones and structures, overlooked by a imposing castle.

boardgame.name: Castle of the Deathknight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a domain filled with spectral mist, the Deathknight rides ouf from her castle to spread misery and pain

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting the stronghold of an undead wight or knight, with mist-filled chasms, huge glowing skulls and an aura of death!

boardgame.name: The Stump of Elemental Evil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is an official product for Four Against Darkness, and the core Four Against Darkness rulebook is required to play.

The deck contains:

13 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards

boardgame.name: Querimonious Quests of Queenly Querulence
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Free and compact (6 pages) but mighty adventure by famous Erick N. Bouchard for Four Against Darkness game. The adventure features:

Instructions of using Pocket Lands cards with Four Against Darkness game
9 sample geomorph cards prepared for b&w printing

boardgame.name: Alien Petshop
boardgame.description:
Alien Petshop is a light, dice placement and set collection game for 2 to 4 players.

In Alien Petshop, players compete to run the most efficient shop. Gather cute, exotic, and even dangerous pets from across the galaxy. Be careful with dangerous pets as they can overwhelm your shop with pests, slime, or fire!! Hire workers to care for your pets, sell goods, and even mutate your pets into the ultimate designer pets! Collect sets of pets to earn awards worth Victory Points.

Money you have at the end of the game, plus the value of your awards determines your pet shop value and the winner!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Runeslingers: The Awakening
boardgame.description:
Runeslingers The Awakening is a two-player customizable tactical card game. You are a Runeslinger, a wielder of magical incantations called runespells. Runespells derive their power from ancient runestones. The runestones lie scattered across the lands. On your search to find new runestones, you find yourself locked in fierce combat with a rival Runeslinger.

Sling powerful runespells, wield exotic trinkets and protect yourself with magical enchantments called boons. Battle in an epic encounter to reduce the enemy Runeslinger's power from five to zero to claim victory.

Runeslinger’s power mechanic creates numerous opportunities to win a Runeslinger’s encounter. Deal damage, play control, sear your enemy’s cards, disrupt their resources or manipulate them with up to six unique and powerful ailments.

Runeslingers introduces a unique ailment mechanic that allows players to easily apply negative status effects to the enemy Runeslinger. Ailments are easily tracked using the provided ailment cards and game mat. Ailments can be sealed by boons, protecting you from their negative effects.

Runeslingers is easy to learn, but rewards most strategic thinking and careful planning. Runeslingers is designed for lovers of custom deck building and strategy card games.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Strange Visitors to the City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Visitors to the City is divided into four sections:

Strange Visitors to the City, a 2d6 table to characters and the bulk of the book. Each of these eleven different characters fills a two-page spread and offers background info on the character that the GM may run with or ignore. (twenty-two pages)
1d6 Unusual Places, a 1d6 table of city sites that may be used by the GM as encounter hooks, backdrops for conflict, and anything else that comes to mind after reading through the six places. (four pages)
4d6 rumors, to give the GM ideas that can be expanded into encounters. (four pages)
2d4 Hired Goons, another 2d4 hired goons that can be used on their own or combined with the goons that are described in Strange Citizens of the City. (three pages)

boardgame.name: Strange Inhabitants of the Forest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Inhabitants of the Forest is split into three sections:

Strange Inhabitants of the Forest, a 2d6 table to characters and the bulk of the book. Each of these eleven different characters fills a two-page spread and offers background info on the character that the GM may run with or ignore. (twenty-two pages)
Strange Encounters, a 1d12 table that provides the gamemaster with some encounter ideas that can be dropped into almost any forest adventure. Each encounter is a short seed, a concept that exists for one reason: to spark the GM's imagination. (eight pages)
1d12 Travelers on the Road, a dozen more characters to interact with in the forest. (four pages)

boardgame.name: Strange Citizens of the City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Citizens of the City is a collection of characters, possibly monsters, and was written to assist the gamemaster in populating the game world. The characters described within the pages of this slim booklet are divided into four categories:

Strange Citizens of the City, a 2d6 table to characters and the bulk of the book. Each of these eleven different characters fills a two-page spread and offers background info on the character that the GM may run with or ignore. (twenty-two pages)
Hired Goons, a 1d8 table of minor characters who are far less detailed than those characters described in the previous section of the book. At times, the 2d6 characters within the Strange Citizens of the City chapter will list "hired goons" as a special ability of sorts. When that happens, feel free to select a few of those goons from this section. (four pages)
(Possibly) Harmless Wanderers, 2d6 characters that are mostly intended as bizarre encounters the player characters may stumble into when walking the city streets. These characters include no game statistics and are purely descriptive. (four pages)
1d8 Places in the City, eight different locations for the PCs to explore. (four pages)

boardgame.name: Damn Tasty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Umerican 0-Level Adventure

An Umerican Culinary Experience Brought To You By The Go! Afterlife Company

Ever wonder how Go! Bars come up with such tasty flavors like Peppermint Pot Pie? Ever think that it’s odd that Go! Bars are still around and plentiful? Find out as you join the Go! Bar team as wage wights. Find out how they decide on their innovative flavor combinations. Learn about the secret ingredients. Find out if escaping on your bi-annual day off really is a way to taste freedom. Herd your hoard of wage wights past the grease ghouls, avoid your supervisors the skeleton crew, and don’t draw the attention of the quality control in-specter.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: SLASHERS
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SLASHERS is the thirteenth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements."

This month we're KILLING IT! (That was a bad joke. Sorry.)

Slashers takes a look at horror movie style slasher killers with an #iHunt twist.
First off, we break down what slashers are. Spoilers: it's people whose legend, their "mask," takes on a sort of life of its own.
Then we show you how to build a slasher. This includes new game traits for three different "tiers" of slasher killer—from normal mass murderers to killers who are equal parts murderer and force of nature.
Then we give you the Relicts. Relicts are a unique #iHunt kink that hunts with guts and force of will—they're your iconic horror movie "survivor girl" after the cameras stop rolling.
Then we close out with four example slashers, from a hunter gone awry to a creepy doll to a masked massacre man that's... kinda hot?

boardgame.name: Werewolf Attack
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bit of lore: This is Lutton, a small thorp near the capital. The villagers are in dire need of help. A Werewolf has attacked the last two full moons and they fear the worst for the next. They won't survive next winder if the monster is not stopped!

boardgame.name: Inferno Soldier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Burn It With Fire!

Sometimes the cleansing flame is the only way to be sure when it comes to eradicating your enemies, and Inferno Soldier really brings the heat! Within you'll find the inferno soldier fighting style, alongside 20 new feats, gear boosts, weapon special properties, and new pieces of equipment, from firewall debuggers and truthsweepers to dual-process pistoleer and molten commando!

boardgame.name: College of Drifting Echoes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The college of drifting echoes is an institution that teaches about a world beyond our own. Storytellers speak of fantastic adventures, creatures and quests but those who follow this path try to bring those inward images to the outside world, becoming attuned to the shimmering veil that separates dreams and reality. Their music has a soothing hypnotic quality that lets them obfuscate the senses and challenge one's perception of reality.

boardgame.name: Bridgers
boardgame.description:
The city of Hriskalt is a sprawling affair sitting in a depression, sheltered by mountains on either side. It shows hints of its cosmopolitan past in the architecture-built vertically to such a height that the light on the ground is spare and shadows are long. But its glory days are past, as it was ravaged by war, so long ago that no one knows why the war was fought, or even the reasons for it. Though the mountains loom, the city sprawls within their confines, forming an endless metropolis in one direction, never seeming to escape the mountains, even as the buildings scale the rocky sides. And this is considered normal.

The war is very much not over, and forces still vie for the destruction of The City- is merely waged differently. The enemy is now more insidious, warring for the very souls of the people that reside within, and the very knowledge of the war and the toll it takes on The City would ensure Her demise. The Church and the Unseen root out Agents of the enemy by the seemingly capricious laws and Draconian enforcement, in order to enforce some semblance of order within.

Some have the unfortunate circumstance to view and recognize this truth. Whether it is because of an encounter with one of these enemies, some particular ability to witness something better left unseen, or by some other blessing or curse, these people can never go back to their prior ignorance. Sometimes, it happens quickly, and in others more slowly. They begin to see the disappearances that others miss- those people that one day just are not there. Patterns unfold in coincidental occurrences and meaningless scrawl hidden on the walls. And more importantly, they see the reasons that curfew is enforced,and no one is allowed on the streets during the Toll of the Veil.

boardgame.name: Loyal Battle Pals
boardgame.description:
This game is about friendship and travel and silly monster animals. It might remind you of a particular game & media franchise but don’t let that limit you!
Designed with quick play and low math in mind, LBP can be used as a chassis for all sorts of kid-friendly adventuring.

boardgame.name: Schadenfreude
boardgame.description:
Schadenfreude is a trick-taking game for 3-5 players. The game ends when any player has scored more than 40 points, and the winner is the closest to 40 without going over.

The card distribution includes some ranks of negative value, is a "must follow" game, and does not include any trump suits.

The winner of a trick is the person who played the second highest card of the lead suit. That player collects their card and any cards which did not follow suit into a score pile. However, a player can have at most one card of each rank in their score pile. If they would collect a second, both cards are instead discarded. At the end of a hand, a player scores an amount of points equal to the sum of the ranks of the cards they have collected.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Schadenfreude: Add-on Ritterorden

listing.notes:
New in shrink.
Buyer pays shipping. Paypal/Venmo/Zelle. Local pickup in Washington DC welcome, in which case cash is also acceptable.

boardgame.name: Ekstar 2048
boardgame.description:
User Summary

2048 puzzle game: Try to get 2048 points by merging numbers.

boardgame.name: Salvage Hidden Treasures: Bounties of the Abyss
boardgame.description:
Continue in your pursuit to collect the world’s most elusive treasure - this time diving into the eerie depths with the Bounties of the Abyss expansion set.

Bounties of the Abyss Expansion set includes three additional boats plus sixteen additional tiles featuring new artwork, cruel twists of fate and treasures long forgotten to the depths of the ocean will merge seamlessly into your core game of Salvage Hidden Treasures!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Salvage Hidden Treasures

boardgame.name: MathLand
boardgame.description:
Math Land is an educational video game for children and adults.

With it they will learn and obtain reinforcement for the main mathematical operations—addition, subtraction, multiplication, sorting from higher to lower, division, and negative numbers.

It is not just a math app—it’s a real educational adventure!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Lost & Found: New Harvest
boardgame.description:
Build your community, support your family, back your neighbors, and stave off disasters. Any or all can win – or lose.

In medieval North Africa, towns are built by families like yours. Show your strategic and collaborative skills in Lost & Found: New Harvest, a historical strategy game of balance between community and family needs.

Take on one of five roles in a struggle to address dilemmas, overcome crises, and avert disasters that threaten to destroy everything you know and love.

Look out for your family, but be sure to collaborate with your neighbors as well. Any number of players can win, but if anyone goes destitute, everyone loses.

This, the first standalone expansion to Lost & Found, explores how lost and found possessions were addressed under Islamic jurisprudence, as informed by Al-Hidayah and The Distinguished Jurist's Primer. These texts were written in the 12th century by great Islamic scholar and jurists Burhan al-Din al-Marghinani and the polymath Ibn Rushd (Averroes). They provide guideposts for behavior, but it’s up to you to decide how to solve dilemmas.

Explore the ways in which these medieval religious legal systems helped to hold society together and helped to keep neighbors cooperating with one another. Optionally, when you pair Lost & Found: New Harvest with the original, players can take on both Jewish and Muslim roles, and explore how these laws play out for these two communities living in Fustat (Old Cairo) in the 12th century.

Will you follow the laws of lost and found possessions? Will you break them? Will you go above and beyond the law?

Find out in Lost & Found: New Harvest!

boardgame.name: Football Highlights 2052: Double Player Mat
boardgame.description:
A double player mat in the theme of Football Highlights 2052. This is a neoprene mat that has everything you need for two people to play on a deluxe surface.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Football Highlights 2052

boardgame.name: Zone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No one knows what caused the Event. Alien visitors? Collision with another dimension? Whatever it was, it sundered an area on Earth from the laws of nature. And it left wonders behind. Whether you’re on an authorized expedition or breaking quarantine to make some credits, be careful out there: Come back not-quite-human, and the Lab will insist you visit indefinitely.

Zone is a super-slim, self-contained, lo-fi sci-fi RPG about exploring an scientifically impossible landscape on Earth. It's inspired by Roadside Picnic and Annihilation, and built with the same rules as the free 24XX SRD. It's 3 pages and a cover, fitting on two sides of a letter-sized page.

boardgame.name: Rally Round the Flag: Division Command
boardgame.description:
Rally Round the Flag – Division Command is an operational game pitting the Union and Confederate Armies against each other during the three days of the Battle of Gettysburg. Each side is represented by each of the Army, Corps and Division Commanders at the Battle of Gettysburg and the Brigades under their command. Take control of the Confederate Army and use their consolidated command structure to try and wrest control of Gettysburg from the Union.

Or, take control of the Union Army and work to delay the Confederates long enough for reinforcements to arrive. Can the Union survive the confusion of command before Meade can arrive with the Army artillery reserves? Can Lee push forward far enough on the first day to sustain his position for the second and third days? Can you win the Battle of Gettysburg and decide the fate of the American Civil War?

The Division Command level is designed with the ability to take and hold ground. This is represented by controlling the critical road network surrounding the town of Gettysburg. This is accomplished by taking control of specific points along the roads called “March Circles,” and thus scoring Victory Points.

A standard Division Command level game covering all three days of the Battle of Gettysburg can be played in about 8-12 hours. Victory occurs either when you force your opponent’s army to retreat, or you have the majority of the 43 Victory Points by the end of the game. You force your opponent to retreat by having double their amount of Victory Points at the end of a day of battle, thus earning a decisive victory.

Rally Round the Flag – Division Command can also be played as a Campaign Manager within the Rally Round the Flag – Brigade Command game. This allows the Division Command game to act as a “campaign battle generator,” creating tactical battles that can be played in 2 to 3 hours, skipping past unnecessary actions and combats in the Brigade Command system and shaving a 40 to 60 hour long game down to 25 hours or less.

While Rally Round the Flag was painstakingly designed with historical accuracy at its heart, the outcome of the game is not predetermined. The design reflects the tactical, organizational, and operational limits of both Union and Confederate armies and their generals, but how you manage them is up to you. In this battle, your decisions make the difference.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Rally Round the Flag
Rally Round the Flag

boardgame.name: Do It Yourself Alias
boardgame.description:
You get to create the classic game Alias yourself! Choose the words of your liking and write them on the cards. The game itself plays like a regular Alias, a word explanation game where you explain words without reveiling the word itself (or a part of it): whether they are synonyms, antonyms or whatever works best in the situation, this party game sure makes it fun to play with words - and now with the new DIY cards!

In D.I.Y. Alias players come up with their own words based on the topics in the cards. Once you have a word in mind, write it on the card, start explaining and let the other players guess. The first player to reach the finish wins the game!

Content: Double-sided game board, 300 cards, sand timer, rules.

boardgame.name: Shaolia: Great Houses
boardgame.description:
Shaolia: Great Houses is an expansion to Shaolia: Warring States which brings not only new cards, but also new mechanics and game modes to give the players more options in pursuing their paths to victory.

The expansion introduces the titular Great Houses. There is also a solo mode new to Shaolia which introduces a Boss for the player to battle.

A game of Great Houses proceeds much the same as one of Warring States, but with the addition of the Noble House tiles and Quest cards. These two new components work in tandem.

Noble House Tiles
These tiles can be purchased during the purchase phase of the game. The currency to purchase them are Quest cards that players have earned in the game. After a Noble House tile has been purchased, it is immediately replaced by another from the deck.

Noble House tiles are placed near the player’s territory board, and function the same as Level 1 & 2 cards, with one important exception: They cannot be attacked, blocked, or destroyed, so a player will benefit from their abilities until the end of the game.

Quest Cards
If a player completes the requirement listed on a Quest card during their turn, they get to take the quest card into their hands. Another Quest card from the deck is immediately drawn to replace the one taken.

As mentioned previously, Quest cards can be used to purchase Noble House tiles. Alternately, you may sell one a Quest card for 2 gold.

There are two types of Quest cards: ones that are immediately achieved by meeting their requirements, and ones with 2–3 open slots that require players to repeat the action listed on the card that many times before they complete the quest. Cards with these repeating quests can only be completed by whoever does the action first, claiming it with one of their quest trackers.

A game of Shaolia: Great Houses ends the same turn that someone either gains 18 culture, or does 12 damage to their opponent’s palace. Additionally, there will be that previously-mentioned third victory path achieved through completing quests.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shaolia: Warring States

boardgame.name: Scientific Barbarian (No. 1 - Fall 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Post-Apocalyptic Role Playing Megazine You Didn't Know You Needed

With metric tons of mighty new content for your post-apocalyptic or genre-mash fantasy game, SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1 has it all. You’ll be amazed at The Ecology of the Crater Mutant by Levi Combs (Planet X Games), astounded at the robotic mounts of S.A.B.L.E. Rangers by Mike and Elizabeth Stewart (Victorious RPG), and astonished at the malevolent diseases in Mutant Maladies by Skeeter Green (SGP Games). All that and a mini-adventure that’s not-so-mini in Jim Wampler’s The Gene Looms of Janeck-Vacca.

SCIENTIFIC BARBARIAN #1 also includes ongoing features that will continue in every issue, with new mutations, new monsters, new artifacts, Retro Reviews of inspirational source media and material, and of course Scientific Comics right in the back featuring Jolly Balckburn and Travis Hanson!
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Retro Review: Kamandi: The Last Boy on Earth

boardgame.name: Noble Blood
boardgame.description:
A dying man’s last wish to be reunited with his lost son and heir.

Bitter family divisions with their roots steeped in murder and betrayal.

The succession of a fiefdom at stake.

Who has the right to succeed, and who is the right choice?

Parallel Adventures are setting-agnostic adventure modules for roleplaying games. They can be slotted into most fantasy settings with little effort; whether you are running a home-brew setting, Glorantha, Forgotten Realms, or something completely different, Parallel Adventures offer flexible roleplaying challenges your party will enjoy.

As well as being setting-agnostic, Parallel Adventures are also systems-agnostic, and come without any stat blocks. The gamemaster should take the time to read through the adventure and decide on what changes are necessary to make it fit into your world. Depending on the power level of your player characters and your preferred system — be it Dungeon & Dragons 5e, Pathfinder or Savage Worlds — this is where you will have to do the most work. Prominent non-player characters are given a brief description that should serve as a guide to their capabilities, but you will have to do the rest.

boardgame.name: Land of Vampires: Campaign Part One
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

FIVE DUET ADVENTURES

PART ONE OF THE LAND OF VAMPIRES CAMPAIGN—RUNNING FROM LEVEL 3 THROUGH LEVEL 6!

STEP THROUGH THE PORTAL AND INTO A DARK LAND TEEMING WITH VAMPIRES, FAE, WEREWOLVES, AND MORE!

Several thousand years ago, the land of Steymhorod disappeared from the surface of Eldura. What had once been a mountainous region with fragrant springs, moderate summers, and colorful falls descended into the Shadowlands, its borders separated from the rest of the plane by impenetrable mist. At all times, Steymhorod remains under gray clouds, lit only by weak sunlight even at the brightest times of day. The forests remain on the cusp between autumn and winter, a state of living death. And over the land, a dark vampire lord, Draego, rules.

The adventure opens with the PC (or party) arriving in Steymhorod disoriented and confused, hunting an escaped vampire. Fortunately, they encounter an elderly gentleman that points them in the direction of safety… Unfortunately, they are set upon by zombies and forced to flee even as night descends.

A lukewarm welcome greets the party in the small settlement of Willowhold, a town beset by sickness and suspicion. As the adventurers try to intervene, they’ll need to counter the power of the Witchwood and its denizens and then travel to the walled city of St. Sebastian in an attempt to forge further alliances for their quest.

WHAT’S INCLUDED WITH THE ADVENTURE PDF:
In addition to a five-adventure duet campaign arc, this PDF includes:

fifteen new creatures(plus variants!),
five new magic items,
as well as two campaign-specific character backgrounds,
three region maps,
five dungeon maps,
and three encounter maps.


The adventures range across the land of Steymhorod, and we’ve added plenty of worldbuilding, setting, and NPC details alongside several random encounter tables to keep your adventures fresh and fun!

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Depth Track Accessory + Card Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Deluxe Depth Track Expansion is a great way to add a bit of extra flair and theme to your Shadows of Brimstone adventures! This set includes 1 large high-detail plastic Depth Track for use while adventuring down in the dusty Mines of the Old West, as well as 1 textured plastic Hero Posse marker ring and 1 textured plastic Darkness marker ring.

This set also includes 15 new cards for the game (4 Gear, 3 Mine Encounters, 4 Darkness, and 4 Growing Dread). They are themed for racing against time to hold the darkness at bay!

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

boardgame.name: Donostiarrok harriz harri
boardgame.description:
Donostiarrok harriz harri is a cooperative game about the reconstruction of Donostia / San Sebastian after its burning in 1813 by Wellington troops.
The players, representing witnesses of the massacre and inhabitants of the city - Juana Francisca Arsuaga (servant), José Antonio Aguirrebarrena (carpenter), María D. Miloy "La naipera", Vda. de Barbot (maker of cards) and Manuel Joaquín de Alcain Baraibar (merchant and mayor) must rebuild the city, they all win or lose together.

gameplay:
The board represents the burned intramural city, with a grid of paths that the characters must travel.
At start of game the four characters are in the Plaza Nueva among the remains of the city.
The 4 players must rebuild the city. For that they must help each other to figure out where to start the reconstruction and to get the seven parts of the facade of a typical reconstruction building.
To advance, some brick tiles are used and as many bricks as the number of steps you want to advance will be used.
But the reconstruction was not easy and that is why the game also has adversity events (discouragement, illnesses, wars, lack of money).

boardgame.name: Arkham Brochure
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This two-page PDF is intended to be printed out double sided and folded into a brochure, one that has been issued by Arkham's chamber of commerce. It's intended to be used a game prop and is designed for use in the 1920s setting. The brochure itself is based on a similar one found in Kingsport: The City in the Mists, but promoting Arkham instead.

The PDF is U.S. Letter size; if printed on A4, the ends of the page will need trimming.

boardgame.name: 100 Disturbing to Horrifying Fantasy Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a collection of 100 things that characters could encounter in a fantasy setting. They range from those that seem off or just don't seem right to those where there is clearly something wrong, due to the amount of death or blood that can be seen or inferred.

These encounters can be used to add background events to a dark campaign or one where there are definitely bad things happening, or as peculiarities that characters stumble across whilst doing something else. Some could be a potential source of adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Mob of thousands of people who are all afflicted with a disfiguring disease and seek to spread the contagion to others.

Monstrous flapping sounds, as from something with enormous wings, can sometimes be heard coming from a well.

No-one in this village will travel in a group of less than three. Those that are temporarily separated start to panic and desperately join any group of people they see.

Oddly straight paths with sharp corners run through this village. If the paths are mapped, they show the village is at the centre of an enormous pentagram.

On a wall next to the road are half a dozen freshly severed heads. Blood stains the stones of the wall.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: The Flaming Portal
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In The Flaming Portal, the characters are teleported to a villain's lair within a volcano, where they will need to investigate the place to discover how they can get back out again. The villain's motives are unknown.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

This is aimed at d100 systems but is generic enough in nature to be adapted to others.

One page is the front cover, one the front matter, two are maps and one is ads.

boardgame.name: 100 Encounters for Fantasy Plains
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has 100 different encounters that characters could have when travelling though plains, savannahs and grasslands, those places where there is not much but flat ground, to make the journeys more interesting. These can be used to add detail and colour to a journey through a generally boring region or as a source of adventure hooks. Some are potentially useful, some are potentially hazardous and some are simply odd.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

A wagon stands by the side of the road with a broken wheel. The driver is currently repairing the wheel whilst their horse crops the grass. They will appreciate any help, though only have some fresh fruit from the wagon to pay with.

A well-kept house surrounded by a small garden that is enclosed in a fence sits in the middle of the plain. There is no path to the house, nor any nearby settlements. The house, if entered, is in perfect shape, but appears totally unoccupied. It contains food for several days.

A wooden fence has been erected in a square, measuring 30' on each side. The fence lacks a gate and the area inside the fence appears identical to the area outside it.

A wooden palisade stands on a small berm of earth with a ditch in front of it. This appears to be a small fort, but the gate is smashed and the palisade has been breached in several places. Inside, the buildings are falling to ruin and a few old bones can be found.

An arrow laid out in stones points off the path into the distance.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and two thirds of a page is ads.

The supplement is also available in a Pathfinder compatible version. You do not need both versions.

boardgame.name: 100 Encounters for Fantasy Plains (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has 100 different encounters that characters could have when travelling though plains, savannahs and grasslands, those places where there is not much but flat ground, to make the journeys more interesting. These can be used to add detail and colour to a journey through a generally boring region or as a source of adventure hooks. Some are potentially useful, some are potentially hazardous and some are simply odd.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Between two earthen banks runs a large river, though it is greatly diminished at the moment by the looks of it (DC 10 Knowledge (nature)), with muddy areas covering the ground beside it.

Birds can be seen circling in the air some distance away. They can be identified as being vultures (DC 10 Knowledge (nature)) and if the area they are circling is approached, a dead horse can be found, a horse that has been ripped into pieces.

Bodies, 23 all told, lie scattered on the ground. They appear to have died recently, and from violence going by the wounds (DC 10 Heal check to confirm this). Anything of value has been taken.

Boulders stand in a large pile, seemingly natural but on closer examination (DC 10 Knowledge (nature) check or DC 10 Perception check to realise this) each rock appears to have been individually placed.

Brass-bound wood sticks out of the ground, the corner of a buried chest that has been uncovered. The chest is empty save for dust.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter, one page is ads and one the Open Game License.

The supplement is also available in a system neutral version. You do not need both versions.

boardgame.name: 10 Ammunition Spells (5E)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This book provides a variety of spell options for combat-minded spellcasters. Each spell in this book enhances ammunition, granting it powers far beyond its original capabilities. Though the names of many spells refer to specific kinds of ammunition, most affect all kinds of ammunition equally.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are the spells:

Arrow of Remorse
Forceful Shot
Hunting Arrow
Rusting Shot
Sea Bolt
Smoke Arrow
Swarm Shot
Tempest Arrow
Twisting Shot
Waylaying Shot

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter, one page is ads and one the Open Game License.

boardgame.name: 100 Things Dubious Politicians Didn't Want Overheard
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Some politicians are less than entirely honest, and they may accidentally make comments that could be damaging when they didn't think they could be overheard. The comments in this list range from a simple lack of respect for voters or other politicians to the morally dubious to the corrupt to the outright criminal in nature. The comments are most suited for a modern or later setting, but many could be adapted to others. These comments could be used by characters to blackmail a politician into doing what they want, or they could result in the more violently unethical politicians going after them in order to eliminate a threat.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

It will be sneaked in as part of another bill at the end of a session. The others won't know what they are voting for.

It's simple, really. Just create a common enemy for the voters to fear and hate and they won't notice who's really screwing them.

I want reports on all the other members of the committee. I want to know everything about them, especially vulnerabilities and dirt.

Keep looking. If you dig deep enough, everyone has dirt they are hiding.

Leak it to the press. It will be greatly damaging.

One page is the front cover and one page the front matter.

boardgame.name: Slayers City Districts
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement is created for the Slayers RPG from Gila RPGs and was created for the Slayers Jam.

This adds six new districts to The City:

Alchmy
Blackpowder
Fabricant
Graintown
Hospitium
Slaughterhouse


Each district follows the standard format; there is a descriptive overview, a collection of locations, factions and NPCs and finally some rumours.

This PDF uses Adobe layers and the backgrounds and images can be disabled for a printer friendly version.

Slayers RPG by Spencer Campbell is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

boardgame.name: Delver of Tombs
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a new background for Troika! Numinous Edition. The background is for a person who explores ancient tombs for fun and profit..

This is a single page layered PDF.

Compatible with Troika! "Delver of Tombs" is an independent production by Azukail Games and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Fantasy Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alone in the Fantasy Forest is a hack of Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars.

This is a journalling game requiring one player, a pack of 52 standard playing cards and a six-sided die (1d6) or another suitable randomiser.

You are an explorer of fantasy forests, coming across rare treasures of the woodland regions, fae, plant creatures and lost ruins. Perhaps you will find something to make your mark; perhaps you will be swallowed up by the darker regions.

boardgame.name: Enemy Engaged
boardgame.description:
While this is not meant to be the be all and end all of space combat systems, and it will most definitely not be the most complicated of them, it is and will be what we envisioned it to be oh those many years ago when we put together a one page set of rules so that we could play with our miniature toys in the kitchen and in the garage on the weekends.

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Nightmare Rider
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

The marriage between the child of an influential Aldin family and the prince of a Rezean clan is something worth celebrating! When the heroes are hired to accompany an Aldin lady to the marriage bower in Rezea, can they protect her from the myriad threats that endanger the happiness of the new couple?

Nightmare Rider is a Blue Rose AGE adventure for 4 to 6 1st level characters.

boardgame.name: Apples to Apples: Marvel
boardgame.description:
The Apples to Apples game ventures into the dazzling domain of the Marvel Universe with a wide array of Marvel Super Heroes and Villains!

As in the classic game, each player takes turns playing the judge. The round starts by the judge playing a Green Apple card. Everyone else plays a Red Apple card from their hand. These cards, with titles like “Black Widow, ” “Web-shooters, ” and “Hulk’s Pants, ” are brought to life with dynamic Marvel comic book images! Amazing combinations are inevitable, but the judge decides the best match-up for each round.

Watch out for the unique “Thanos Snaps” card; it’s a game-changing wild card removing half of players’ Red Apple cards!

boardgame.name: トランプ再集計!! (Trump Recount!!)
boardgame.description:
The game トランプ再集計!! (Trump Recount!!) consists of a board which shows a map of the United States, with some "battleground" states in white, and other states colored red or blue, to represent their political leanings in the 2020 United States' presidential election. The game board lists 13 battleground states, and places to play cards for each state along the edge. (Players must provide their own cards.) The map has a scale showing the progress of J.BIDEN and D.TRUMP towards an electoral college victory.

One player takes the red cards (diamonds and hearts) from a deck of cards, and the other player takes the remaining suits (clubs and spades). First the players gather their heart and spade cards, and, beginning with the red player, alternate placing cards at the 13 battleground states. Then, the players do the same with the other suits.

Afterwards, the "counting" phase begins, and players have several options, such as to privately count a state and either declare victory or announce that the counting is still in progress; recount a state where your opponent has declared victory; ask for a public recount; or pass.

If any player declares defeat, the opponent's side wins. If neither player declares defeat, the game will never end.

boardgame.name: The Creed of Auril
boardgame.description:
From the DMsGuild product page:

The Frostmaiden has come to claim Icewind Dale!

Haughty, overbearing, mercurial, uncaring, and fickle, Auril is not a benevolent goddess waiting to shower the world with warmth and compassion. Like the winter she ushers in and controls, the Frostmaiden is cold, dangerous, and unpredictable. She is an evil goddess who allows, and even finds joy in, her most devout followers sacrificing, tormenting, and persecuting her enemies.

Not only is Auril creating problems in Icewind Dale, but now you can unleash her cultists to wreak havoc in Ten-Towns!

Extensive Information on the Church of Auril for your Rime of the Frostmaiden game!

This product features:
Descriptions of cult beliefs, behaviors, and rationale
16 new spells
2 new magic items
6 new NPC/creature statblocks
Over 12 new ways to add cultists and cult activity to the area
23 pages of useful content!

boardgame.name: El Juego de Santander
boardgame.description:
El Juego de Santander
The game focuses on the city of Santander, its streets, local businesses and monuments are on the board.

The game play is a mixture of the game of goose and monopoly

To win: acquire businesses and leave the city.

boardgame.name: Summon Skate
boardgame.description:
In Summon Skate you play a Figure Skater. No, not the kind you’re thinking. Instead you are a summoner who skates out complex magical diagrams to summon Figures - mythical gods and creatures - to fight giant monsters of chaos in high-speed, tactical battles.

The gameplay of Summon Skate is divided between puzzle solving/investigation and tactical combat. Players will check out strange happenings in their city to piece together the true nature of the chaos manifesting there. These investigations generally involve making checks using the simple 3 Attribute, 2D6 roll-under resolution system. Once the mystery is solved, the chaos gathers and takes on a physical form born from human nightmares - a Chaos Figure, the main enemies of this game.

Once combat with the Chaos Figure begins, the players are teleported to a magical stage represented by a 12 x 12 grid. Each turn, players must use their limited movements points to draw out summoning diagrams on the grid. Once a diagram is completed, players can summon the Figure tied to the diagram. Summoned Figures are the primary means of fighting, guarding, healing and supporting in the game. Meanwhile the enemy Chaos Figure will spend its turns trying to either kill the player characters directly or shatter the stage by creating cracks that extend from one side to the other. If all the players run out of HP or the stage is completely shattered, it’s game over and the world falls to chaos. You’ll need cooperation and planning to make it through these battles alive.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: カリフ(Caliph)
boardgame.description:
An Islamic roll and move game like Monopoly.
Players trying to become the Caliph in 10th century Abbasid Baghdad.
Japanese ulamā Prof. Dr. Hassan Ko Nakata supervised the game.

boardgame.name: Valkyrie Game System, set 1: Dungeon Placards
boardgame.description:
A playing aid for adventure games using 25mm miniatures.

Dungeon Placards enhance your campaign with visual effects. Players can map moves and resolve combat problems. Games Masters can track all players with ease.

Contents: 10 card sheets representing flooring, stairways, furniture, etc.

boardgame.name: For The Greater Good: A Tales of Estirwald Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are the best of times; there are the worst of times; and then there are the current times. War, famine and disease run rampant across the realms. Rumour has it that whole cities have been swallowed into the depths of hell. Thay is expanding its borders. Yet in the area around Estirwald all is calm and bountiful. Many just consider themselves lucky, that is, until an urgent call from Ambledragon is sent out. What could be so urgent to someone as old and powerful as he is?

A Four to Six-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: A Whisper In Your Mind
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When you hear a faint whisper in your head of an urgent plea for help will you answer the call? What if answering puts you all at risk? What rules and laws exist in the Mournland mists?

A Four hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 7.

A Whisper In Your Mind is a DDAL - Oracle of War salvage mission for Tier 2 characters that can be completed in approximately 4 hours.

It is Adventurers League Legal if used in conjunction with Oracle of War: Salvage Bases and Missions.

boardgame.name: House of Masks
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

This adventure was written for the Unite the Factions Extra Life Day 2019. All author proceeds from the sale of the adventure will be donated to Extra Life.

This adventure is a little different. Inspired by board games, House of Masks combines on-the-spot improv with using character skills to create social interactions that can be actively won and lost. Characters get to play through a few of these, creating a unique experience. The adventure's story takes place at a grand ball and has been designed to allow for other DMs, players from other tables, or special guests to get involved in the roles of NPCs. This of course is not required, as at it's still very much a single-table adventure.

House of Masks serves as an fun interlude of sorts in the Spies Below the Moonsea series, and as such doesn't require knowledge of the other adventures in the series, or to be followed-up by another adventure. It's entirely self-contained.

boardgame.name: House of Diamonds, or, Treasure of the Axcelon Mine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New allies in the Underdark have emerged and are working to liberate drow-taken slaves from around the Moonsea. Key to this endeavor is finding a safe and secret passage between the Underdark and the surface. Rumors tell of such a passage deep within the abandoned Axcelon Diamond Mine. Yet the passage is the least of the treasures and dangers that the mine holds.

A Two- to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: Doubloons
boardgame.description:
Doubloons is a 2-6 player card game of pillage and plunder. Take the helm of a pirate ship in a race for 7 doubloons. Along the way, hire the help from history's most prolific pirates like Samuel Bellamy, Anne Bonny, Ching Shih, and more.

It takes less than 5 minutes to learn. There are two types of cards in the game: action cards and pirate cards. Each player receives 5 action cards to start. On your turn, you draw an action card and then can play up to 3 action cards. Action cards allow you to do things like collect doubloons, draw cards, and steal from other players.

You can choose to spend doubloons in order to recruit pirates onto your crew. These pirates give you effects that can be used once on every turn. Different combinations of action cards and pirates allow you to accelerate your path to victory and decelerate your opponents.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Saccorian Job
boardgame.description:
A one-round mid-level adventure
3 ABY (After Battle of Yavin)

From the introduction:

As the efforts of the Corellian Rebellion had turned into a number of successes and victories, even at a high cost, the attention and aid of Alliance High Command was more present. On her third trip to the Corellian Sector in recent weeks, Mon Mothma, the head of state has requested a team of high profile rebel agents to support her diplomatic mission.

boardgame.name: Lock, Stock, and a Smoking Blaster Barrel
boardgame.description:
A one-round adventure
3 ABY (After Battle of Yavin)

From the introduction:

The last week had been very busy with supplies coming in and out of your base. Rush orders came from all over the sector for a drop to resupply troops on the ground, sometimes even in the thick of a firefight, and you gladly lent a hand when you could. Corfai and Selonia had been seeing a lot of small attacks recently that left all rebels forces in the area dead. If you could catch or even find out who was making those hit and run raids it would make future plans that much better.

boardgame.name: Fury and Thunder
boardgame.description:
A one-round low level adventure
2 ABY (After Battle of Yavin)

From the introduction:

Reciprocity base is under attack and the corellian cells are the only ones who are able to respond. They will have to decide on if they want to force back the forces on the ground or in orbit. The 3 approaches are different types of battles. The ground choice is a defensive battle in which they much evacuate as many of the remaining Alliance personnel as possible, while the orbital battle will require them to take out the enemy’s flag ship star destroyer. There is also a suicide mission to fight their way through the Eviscerator and disable it.

boardgame.name: Base, Ship and Downtime Rules for Season 2-
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Without the Rebel Alliance to fund the party, there are new costs and responsibilities they must pay for themselves.

User summary:

This document presents numerous rules governing ships, bases, money, and downtime activities.

boardgame.name: Monaco: What's Yours is Mine.
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Monte Carlo. This city is my prison, and you are going to help me escape. Listen closely, this will be a four-man operation. First, bring me a locksmith, a man whose fingers move in his sleep. He doesn’t need brains, no, just a particular set of talents. Have you seen the beggar with the monkey? This man shall be our pickpocket. We also need a woman, a lookout. Someone who is trained from youth to see danger around every corner. And lastly, a man who cannot control his violent urges. Bring me a man familiar with chloroform.

boardgame.name: Endless Winter: Paleoamericans – Big Box
boardgame.description:
Originally available as an add-on during the Endless Winter: Paleoamericans Kickstarter campaign.

Features:

297x376x123 mm
Deluxe core trays
Tray for current expansions
Spot UV
Frost finish
Embossed logo
Fits current & future expansions
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Endless Winter: Paleoamericans

boardgame.name: Heroes of Baseball
boardgame.description: 'Heroes of Baseball is a 2-player baseball card game that replicates the real-life game decisions of a baseball manager. The game consists of randomly-generated fictional players, and operates on a d100 (percentile) system.

boardgame.name: Aleph Null
boardgame.description:
As a successful Magician, you have been able to fund a lifetime of research by delivering to the petty demands of liars, philanderers, gluttons and the least of Humanity.

How refreshing, then, when a client should emerge with a commission of horrifying simplicity that has the potential for acquiring a vast amount of knowledge - perhaps the ultimate knowledge - albeit at the expense of many millions.

"Release the denizens of Hell into the Earth, with Baphomet - The Sabbath Goat - at their Head, for one night only and let them run amok. Let us see the consequences - for aesthetic reasons only, of course."

However, do not expect this matter to proceed without interference from the Church and/or from Hell itself: the best-laid plans do not always go the way expected.

Inspired by the Black Easter novellas by James Blish, the aim of Aleph Null is to successfully summon the demonic Prince Baphomet who, when he appears, expects there to no cards in your hand, the main deck and the discard pile; if there are any cards remaining in these ‘zones’, you lose. However, ‘not losing’ in this way doesn’t mean that you have won: any cards still in play also count against you – too many and you shall lose also. The sooner you ‘win’, the better your chance of surviving any due punishment.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kamen Raidā Batoraido Wō Sōsei
Kamen Rider: Battride War Genesis
仮面ライダー バトライド・ウォー 創生
boardgame.description:
The third title called Kamen Rider: Battride War Genesis (仮面ライダー バトライド・ウォー 創生, Kamen Raidā Batoraido Wō Sōsei) was announced in September 2015 to be released on February 25, 2016 for the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3 and PlayStation Vita. It is part of the anniversary project to celebrate the Kamen Rider franchise's 45th anniversary, and will feature characters from both all Showa Rider TV series, Kamen Rider Drive and Kamen Rider Ghost after a year of hiatus during Kamen Rider Drive's airing, as well as feature characters who were originally only NPCs and Assist Call characters in Battride War II and the Shōwa era Kamen Riders, which were absent from both previous installments of the game.

The game features an original story where the evil Shadow Moon, rival of Kamen Rider Black makes the first monsters each Kamen Rider has faced much stronger, killing him and other Kamen Riders before they truly have a chance to become heroes. He starts off with Kamen Rider 1, and with his death, the history of all Kamen Riders is rewritten. The only ones unaffected are Kamen Rider Ghost, as he is already dead, and Kamen Rider Den-O, who has the Den-Liner that can travel through time and preventing his history as a Kamen Rider from being rewritten. The two work together to save the Kamen Riders and restore the original timeline so Kamen Riders live to protect the world.

Kohei Murakami was announced to reprise his role as Masato Kusaka/Kamen Rider Kaixa from Kamen Rider 555.

Hiroshi Fujioka reprises his role as Takeshi Hongo, Kamen Rider 1, in the video game.[21][22] First edition copies of the game will come with a DLC code to access a special mission pack and a special Shocker costumed version of Takeshi Hongo.
As part of the promotion of Kamen Rider Drive Saga: Chaser V-Cinema release, Kamen Rider Drive's Kamen Rider Chaser was announced to be a downloadable character, followed by Kamen Rider Ghost's Kamen Rider Specter and then Kamen Rider Ghost Toucon Boost Damashii to be released around Thursday, each weeks on March after two weeks of the game's release.

The game's theme is Tourbillon's song "Colorless Images", from their upcoming album The Decade: 10th Anniversary Best.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamen_Rider%3A_Battride_War%23Kamen_Rider%3A_Battride_War_Genesis Kamen Rider: Battride War]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Special Attractions (fan expansion for Draftosaurus)
boardgame.description:
After a period of sustained success, the visitors to your zoo have become complacent and are clamoring for more. It's time to introduce some Special Attractions to your dino park! In this fan-made print-and-play expansion for Draftosaurus, players will draft cards that provide an additional way to score points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Draftosaurus

boardgame.name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Twisted Loyalties
La Légende des Cinq Anneaux JCE: Loyautés Douteuses
boardgame.description:
Throughout history, the Great Clans of Rokugan have held strong to their beliefs. Whether it is the Crab Clan’s adamant defense against the Shadowlands, the Lion Clan’s pride in battle, or the Scorpion Clan’s resolve to do whatever is necessary to serve the Emerald Empire, each of these seven great powers has an ideal that they uphold, a purpose that has become almost synonymous with the clan itself. Steadfast and true, each of the Great Clans walks their respective paths with unflinching resolve.

And yet… temptations still exist.

Twisted Loyalties, the first Dynasty Pack of the Temptations cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game features 60 brand-new cards (three copies each of nineteen different cards and one copy each of three different cards) to enhance your favorite decks and introduce new mechanics to the game, such as the Dire keyword that opens up new abilities when a character has no fate on them!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game
